intro: Clidemia serpens, commonly known as the creeping stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive hairy texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact with the skin. Clidemia serpens plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
